info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued March 18 at 2:28PM CDT until March 19 at 2:00PM CDT by NWS North Platte NE
info.description:
Forecast trends this morning have decreased snow accumulations across the Sandhills and portions of Central Nebraska. The combination of wind and snow will lead to blizzard or near blizzard conditions over far southwestern Nebraska into portions of the eastern Sandhills and central Nebraska. Accumulating snow is also expected over the Pine Ridge of Sheridan County and a winter weather advisory is in effect for the northeastern Nebraska Panhandle.
* WHAT...Blizzard conditions expected. Total snow accumulations between 1 and 3 inches. Northerly winds 30 to 40 mph gusting as high as 60 mph.
* WHERE...Holt County.
* WHEN...From 1 AM to 2 PM CDT Wednesday.
* IMPACTS...Visibilities may drop below 1/4 mile due to falling and blowing snow. Whiteout to near whiteout conditions are possible. Plan on slippery road conditions. Strong winds could cause tree damage.
info.instruction:
Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle.
Call Nebraska 5 1 1 for the latest road information.

parameter.value: BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 AM TO 2 PM CDT WEDNESDAY
